page.title: 11CAVING ON MENDIP
page.content: The Mendips are one of the most popular caving areas in Britain-within easy reach of London via the M4 and Birmingham & the north via the M5. There are a number of local clubs and other groups such as schools & Scouts. The spot is becoming more popular & pressure on some caves is severe. Congestion, litter, grafffitti and destruction of formations are problems which clubs are trying to solve. This block contains three spectacular caves-Manor Farm, Longwood Swallet & Rhino Rift. Many are locked for safety and prevention of vandalism. These are caves for the caver not the tourist. Anyone caving on Mendip needs to take the correct equipment, an experienced leader & leave a message with someone.The{Mendip Rescue {Organisation}respond to calls for help
